newsitem.title: ROMANIA: RADIO ROMANIA AFTERNOON HEADLINES AT 1 PM.
newsitem.headline: RADIO ROMANIA AFTERNOON HEADLINES AT 1 PM.

text.p: * British Foreign Secretary Malcolm Rifkind met president Emil Constantinescu, Foreign Minister Adrian Severin and Prime Minister Victor Ciorbea in the morning.
* Constantinescu to start talks with leaders of opposition parties in the afternoon.

* Defence Minister Victor Babiuc awarded medals of honour to military attaches of NATO member-countries in Romania to celebrate three years since the creation of NATO's Partnership for Peace (PFP) scheme and since Romania joined the PFP.
* Democratic Convention leader Ion Diaconescu met representatives of the BNS trade union to set up a system of regular consultations.
* Unemployment in Romania will double by the end of 1997, a representative of the United Nations Development Programme told the state news agency Rompres.
He said measures to artificially keep unemployment at low levels last year had triggered the drop in the real value of the average wage. -- Bucharest Newsroom 40-1 3120264
